dialogues.text: Hmph! Another stray mutt running around the neighborhood. Don't you dare dig up my garden!
Neighborhood watch? BAH! Back in my day, we didn't need dogs to keep order. Get off my lawn!
You SHOULD be sorry! These raccoons are bad enough without dogs trampling my flower beds. Now shoo!
You again?! I told you to stay away from my property! ...Though I suppose the raccoon problem IS getting worse...

choices.text: I can help with the raccoons.
Need me to guard the grate?

dialogues.text: If you're so eager to help, guard the grate by the old buildings. The raccoons keep prying it up at night.
Help? Hmph. I doubt it. But... fine. If you can clear out those pests, maybe I'll think about being... less hostile. Maybe.
Good. And don't come back until you've done something useful for once!
Oh... it's you. I heard you took down one of those mini-boss creatures. I suppose that's... somewhat impressive.
Don't get cocky, mutt. But... the raccoons haven't touched my garden since. So... thanks. I guess.
Hmph. Modest too. You know, you remind me of a dog I had as a boy. Good dog, that one. Kept the foxes out of the henhouse.
Momi! There you are. I've been keeping an eye out for you. The garden's been safe thanks to your patrols.

choices.text: Glad to hear it, Mr. Henderson!
Any trouble I should know about?

dialogues.text: Call me... well, just Henderson is fine. I left some treats by my front door. For the neighborhood watch. Don't tell anyone I'm going soft!
Actually, yes. I've noticed suspicious activity near the old buildings. Strange noises at night. You might want to investigate the rooftops.
And Momi? Be careful up there. I've grown rather fond of having you around. Not that I'd ever say that to your face!
